definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])

sentences.english: This season his trigger-happy days are becoming few and far between.
sentences.chinese: 这个赛季他胡搅蛮缠的时候渐渐减少。

sentences.english: Above all I do not wish to importune or compromise you.
sentences.chinese: 总之我不希望你胡搅蛮缠或妥协。

definition: to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
to mess around/to mess with something/to have an affair
no respect for seniors/lacking in manners
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to muddle things together (idiom)/to bother sb with annoying muddle-headed talk
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
